Case Manager - Worker's Compensation VIC

Company Name Gallagher Bassett Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 10 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Job Description
  • Begin your Insurance and Worker’s Compensation Career
  • Genuine career development and progression
  • Work for a global organisation, with over 27,000 people worldwide in over 140 countries
Gallagher Bassett is Australia’s largest Third Party Administrator (TPA). Our focus is refreshingly simple: We manage insurance claims on behalf of insurers, brokers, government bodies and self-insured organisations.

We are proud to be one of 135 companies from 23 countries and representing 57 industry categories, named on the Ethisphere Institute’s 2018 World’s Most Ethical Companies list for the seventh consecutive year.

The position

We are currently recruiting for multiple Case Managers to join our office located in Melbourne CBD.

These positions are permanent and full time roles and will see you provide a cost effective, professional and customer focused workers compensation claims service through processing and managing a portfolio of short term claims.

Responsibilities Include But Are Not Limited To
  • Taking ownership of portfolio of Medical Expenses Only and Closed Period Claims
  • Providing Workers Compensation claims advice to all stakeholders
  • Providing customer service to injured workers and all stakeholders
  • Complying with the relevant Acts and other relevant Legislative requirements
  • Building rapport with providers and employers to monitor effective medical and like programs for injured workers
  • Utilising claims management tools to influence return to work
  • Liaising with providers and employers to monitor effective medical and like programs for injured workers

Job Qualifications

 What are we looking for ?
  • Completion of Year 12 VCE or equivalent qualification
  • Demonstrated recent work experience within customer service role
  • Excellent customer service skills
  • The ability to work within a fast paced environment
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Exceptional time management, prioritisation and organisational skills
  • Knowledge of general business and administrative practices
  • Analytical / problem solving skills
  • PC Literacy – Database Software and Microsoft office

What We Can Offer You
  • Flexible work hours
  • Staff referral incentive
  • Opportunities for ongoing education and development
  • Service recognition awards
  • Employee assistance program for yourself and immediate family members
  • Personal touches like weekly fruit bowls and birthday celebrations
  • The opportunity to work for a company that gives back to the community through our Gentle Bear program

To apply

If you think you can make a positive difference to our business we want to hear from you today!

Click on Apply for this Job.

Only people with the right to work in this country will be considered for this position.

Agency candidates will not be considered for this role.

Key Account Specialist

Company Name Transurban Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 53 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • 727 Collins St, VIC
  • Fixed-term, Full-time
  • 12 months


Our Customers are what drives our business and we love creating long term partnerships in order to understand their needs to get them where they need to be. The core functionality of a Key Account Specialist is multi-faceted. You will manage a portfolio of key accounts by being pro-active, assisting with any queries and providing quality customer support to them. You will also provide recommendations to the business based on insights and analysis carried out using various reporting tools and systems. This role is an opportunity to leverage your commercial nous and previous account management experience to take your career to the next level.

Sitting in our Customer Experience team, you’ll be part of a department that puts people first. We never stop exploring new ways to make life better, inside Transurban and out. Neither will you. Collaboration and development are top of our agenda- we want you to make an impact that extends far beyond the job you excel at. That’s why we’ll encourage you to share your ideas as we help you pursue the career you want.

The impact you’ll have
  • You’ll be responsible for maintaining and enhancing our existing commercial relationship with a small portfolio of key clients, always keeping them front of mind and going above and beyond to make it work
  • You’ll view everything as a partnership, effectively implementing account plans, conducting regular health checks and identifying ways both parties can optimise the existing relationship to create future strategic successes
  • You’ll use your reporting and analysis skills to interpret and provide insights to the business on better ways of working, trend identification, efficiency opportunities and overall value add activity
  • You’ll think of new ways of doing things, and provide support on internal projects or initiatives that will directly impact your portfolio
  • You’ll work closely with stakeholders across the business, maintain and achieving benefit through strong positive relationships with key internal service providers including Billing, Credit, Digital, IT and Customer Care.

The talents you’ll bring
  • Prior account management experience, with some prior experience managing commercial or high value accounts across multiple regions or territories viewed favourably (minimum of 3+ years in a similar role)
  • You’ll enjoy problem solving, and can demonstrate prior successes resolving complex customer account management escalations to achieve mutually beneficial outcomes
  • As a strong communicator, you enjoy dealing with various stakeholders, both technical and non-technical, internal and external
  • You’ll have the ability to prioritise, delegate and remain calm in a crisis. You’re also keen to get your hands dirty to resolve a situation
  • You’re an excel guru, and enjoy manipulating data to create more meaningful information that can be used to aid decision making.


About Us

Transurban is driven by bringing people and places closer. The roads we plan, build, operate and maintain make communities stronger, across Australia and beyond. Together, we’re building a future that marries traditional infrastructure with emerging technology. We’re making roads ready for driverless cars and predicting accidents before they happen. We’re getting people where they’re going. And we’re doing it faster, smarter and safer, every last one of us.

Start changing the world around you. Click Apply now.

Senior Electrical Engineer – Projects

Company Name Aggreko Company Location Braeside, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 134 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Due to growth in our projects business, we are seeking an enthusiastic Electrical Engineer to assist the Australia Pacific business with a variety of work including project scoping, design, installation, commissioning and technical and product assistance.\xa0


While we are ideally seeking candidates with 3 to 5 years’ experience in remote and grid connected power generation projects, more experienced candidates are also encouraged to apply. A growing area of our business also includes renewable energy projects and energy storage. Some experience in client facing situations would be preferred.


Role accountabilities will include;

  • Analysis of client system load profiles, system drawings and electrical plant characteristics to determine sizing of power generation packages.
  • Use of a variety of electrical modelling software in designing and documenting project parameters and requirements
  • Specification of electrical plant and cabling systems
  • Design of schematic and layout drawings.
  • Liaise with client's technical staff and visit potential job sites, as required, to verify project needs.
  • Advise Sales team on specific design issues and propose engineering solutions.
  • Provide engineering assistance as required to the Australia Pacific business.
  • Site commissioning & performance evaluation.


Required Education & Skills:

  • Electrical Engineering qualification with a minimum of 3 years industry experience in an electrical power systems business. Exposure to power generation, high voltage systems and project management would be highly regarded
  • A good communicator, both written and oral.
  • Available to travel on a Regional basis (AusPac)
  • Ideally, an understanding of power system and earthgrid modelling tools


Our Culture & Benefits

People development is at the heart of Aggreko’s global Human Resources strategy; each part of our business has training programmes in place to ensure our employees have the necessary skills to perform their jobs to a high level. We offer generous benefit plans for our employees, as well as opportunities for long term career development and succession plans. Whist our business operates 24 hours a day/365 days a year, we encourage and support flexible working conditions.


Our Values; "Be Dynamic, Be Expert, Be Together, Be Innovative"

There is real pride in working for Aggreko. Jobs are varied, exciting and fun. Playing for ‘Team Aggreko’ means you will be resilient, customer focused, have the drive for results and commitment to getting the job done!


Aggreko is an Equal Opportunity employer, dedicated to providing a work environment in which everyone feels safe, included, treated fairly and with respect. We embrace diversity and invite female and Indigenous applicants to consider working at Aggreko.


For more information on the role, please forward your application with a cover letter addressing your key areas of experience and click the Apply button below.

Contact the job poster

Bridget O'Neill

AUSPAC Internal Recruitment Lead at Aggreko

Project Director, Energy Commercial Negotiations (STS)

Company Name Department of Environment, Land, Water and Planning Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 6 hours ago Number of views 22 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Project Director, Energy Commercial Negotiations (STS)


  • Lead negotiations for large scale renewable energy projects
  • Frontline strategic leadership role
  • Salary package up to $220,000


Lead the development and implementation of negotiations on large scale renewable energy projects on behalf of DELWP.


The Department & Division


The Department of Environment, Land, Water and Planning (DELWP) is tasked with ensuring that Victoria has the right conditions to enable economic growth, while delivering liveable, inclusive and sustainable communities.

The Energy Commercial Projects division leads the on time and on budget delivery of projects and programs across Victoria’s energy portfolio, facilitating the implementation of the Victorian Renewable Energy Target (VRET).


The Role


This position will lead the development of negotiations strategy and act as the lead negotiator for key energy related commercial engagements. The role will project manage cross functional DELWP teams in the development of complex offer development and negotiations, including managing negotiation issues to closure and driving internal consensus on key issues related to pricing and business and legal terms and conditions. This role will act as a key advisor to both the Minister for Energy, Environment and Climate Change and the DELWP leadership team.


The Candidate


The ideal candidate will be able to demonstrate a proven track record in leading large scale, strategic commercial negotiations between the government and commercial sectors (through to closure), ideally within an energy or major Infrastructure related setting.

An executive level leader, you will have significant experience in facilitating creative problem solving strategies, with expertise in strategic planning and consultation in a complex deal setting.

\xa0

For further information or a confidential discussion, please contact Cameron Heaney at Who Group on 03 8636 4010.


To apply for this role, please email a copy of your resume to cheaney@whogroup.com.au quoting reference number 3417 in the header.


Please note - all direct and 3rd party applications or enquiries will be forwarded directly to Who Group for consideration.


Applications will close at midnight on Sunday the 23rd September.

Job description

The Company

Centric Wealth is a leading wealth management firm, providing our clients with personalised advice and solutions for their complete financial well-being. We believe that clients invest in our advice for a financial return, emotional benefits and as a way to ensure that their best laid plans are not derailed.


We put our clients at the heart of everything we do. We are able to do this because Centric Wealth is not owned by a large financial institution. We are not owned by a financial institution, bank, or insurer, so we work with you to help you find the best solutions for your lifestyle and personal circumstances. This gives our clients the confidence that comes from advice that is both expert and holistic.

\xa0
The Role

We have a fantastic opportunity available for a Senior Financial Planner to join our established Melbourne office on a permanent full-time basis.

This role will provide strategic financial planning and investment advice to a sustainable and profitable portfolio of clients as well as introducing possible alternative efficiencies where it suits the client’s needs. Furthermore, you will generate revenue by winning new clients whilst continuing to service existing relationships to drive loyalty and retention.

Your key deliverables will include:

  • Collaborating\xa0and communicating with clients to understand their financial objectives \xa0 \xa0\xa0
  • Providing\xa0strategic financial planning and investment advice including asset\xa0allocation, investment structures, estate planning, superannuation and retirement planning.\xa0
  • Servicing,\xa0retaining and delivering solutions to meet client needs developing\xa0relationships and prospecting new opportunities through your strong\xa0 business development expertise\xa0
  • Achieving\xa0annual revenue targets\xa0
  • Maintaining\xa0professional relationships with key internal and external stakeholders\xa0 \xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0
  • Supervising\xa0day-to-day client service advisory activities\xa0

Qualifications & Experience

  • 5+ years financial planning experience
  • Bachelor of Finance or Commerce (or related degree with Finance major)
  • CFP qualified

Skills & Knowledge

  • Strong relationship and stakeholder management skills
  • Strong commercial acumen
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Strong analytical skills
  • Diplomatic, personable, and professional
  • Collaborative team player

This role provides an outstanding opportunity to work as part of a highly regarded team in a collaborative environment.\xa0If you are seeking a new challenge where your performance and contribution is valued and you are motivated by the opportunity of being part of a growing business, we want to meet you!

Next Steps:

If this sounds like an exciting opportunity that aligns with your experience and career goals, we want to hear from you. Please submit your Cover Letter and Resume today.

Please note that only successful candidates will be contacted.

856339898:
[

Property Manager

Company Name Woolworths Group Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 6 hours ago Number of views 5 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

An exciting opportunity exist for an Property Manager to join the Woolworths team!
  • State, multi site scope
  • Career progression and growth
  • Attractive remuneration package


About Our Opportunity

The Woolworths Property group is accountable for all property undertakings for the organisation. It exists to provide comprehensive proactive property solutions to support Woolworths Retail businesses and their future growth. We are currently seeking a detail-driven, enthusiastic Property Leasing Manager to join the team. Reporting to a Regional Property Manager within the State Team you will assist in strategically growing the trading supermarket and liquor businesses through the delivery of new stores and optimisation of existing network together supporting the retail operations team through effective and professional property management duties.This role is based at the Victorian Support Office in Mulgrave, Victoria.

About You

WOW People are great people. Whether we’re learning new things, seizing the initiative, or winning together our customers are at the heart of everything we do. If you’re the sort of individual who takes accountability and strives to always do the right thing for each other, our communities, our customers, and our business then we ought to connect.

Tasks to be performed by the Property Manager are-
  • Assist the Regional Property Manager to develop and collaborate on the property reviews that outlines our network objectives for new and existing stores.
  • Assist Regional Property Manager in the implementation of Property Plan and Renewal Plan.
  • Achievement of owner contributions toward refurbishments at end of lease cycle.
  • Ensure Lease structures are consistent with the Property Negotiation Criteria and enhance our long term competitive position.
  • Monitor and ensure Landlord obligations under leases are being met with regard to repair & maintenance and protection of trading amenity
  • Negotiating the best commercial outcome for the business when dealing with external stakeholders
  • Maintain and grow key relationships with centre managers and our Landlords.
  • Accurate reporting to management of key performance criteria and market conditions
  • Identify opportunities to improve the amenity of our stores for customers and team, as well as identifying strategies to implement these improvements.
  • Issues that affect delivery of a project are identified and escalated for resolution in a timely manner. Ensure that stores are visited annually by the Property Management Team to monitor the centre and amenity conditions.
  • Attend to lease administration issues, landlord and customer queries /issues in a timely manner.


Key Skills Required-
  • Established authentic customer-centric focus and passion to improve the patronage of our businesses
  • Degree qualified in Property, Business, Commerce or related disciplines
  • 5+ years commercial experience and knowledge of the property market
  • Business, planning and financial skills, including the ability to develop budgets.
  • Excellent communication, influencing and negotiation skills to achieve results and productive relations.
  • Exposure to the retail management and development environment.
  • Experience in presenting proposals in a clear, simple written and oral form, with sound economic justification, in a timely manner and accepting accountability for the team’s outcome.
  • The ability to establish and grow strong relationships with key internal and external stakeholders.
  • Desire to succeed in a competitive environment.


What We Offer

A career with Woolworths will both challenge and reward you, providing growth opportunities and the prospects to advance your career. You will have exposure to highly skilled people and access to a host of staff benefits including-
  • Attractive Remuneration Package - including base salary, Tool of Trade motor vehicle, super and incentive scheme.
  • Added Benefits - Including staff discount, free parking, corporate healthcare options
  • Training and Education - We pride ourselves in helping you realise your potential.
  • An exciting career - As our business grows, so do the opportunities for our people
  • Flexibility and Autonomy


About Us

Founded in 1924, Woolworths Limited is Australia's largest retailer with more than 3,000 stores across Australia and New Zealand employing more than 195 000 people. Woolworths Ltd manages some of Australia's most recognised and trusted brands including Woolworths, Caltex Woolworths, Countdown, Dan Murphy's, BWS, Langtons, Cellarmasters, Big W, and ALH.

We endeavour to create a world class experience for our customers across all of our stores and platforms.

From retail operations at the heart of every community in Australia to commercial and expertise support functions that operate globally we’re a large company with a heart - our people are everything.

The Woolworths Property group is accountable for all property undertakings of the organisation. It exists to provide comprehensive proactive property solutions to support Woolworths Retail businesses and their future growth.

Want to connect? Connect with me on LinkedIn (Brett Beauchamp) We’re also social! - connect with us at #WOWcareers through LinkedIn #LI, Facebook, Instagram or via www.wowcareers.com.au

Sound like your next opportunity? Apply now or head along to www.wowcareers.com.au to discover more!
